Description: This session will focus on realizing recent advancements in defining potently effective immunotherapies for childhood leukemias and lymphomas to pediatric patients with high-risk solid malignancies. We will first discuss strategies to identify immunotherapeutic targets based on the unique epigenomic underpinnings of these cancers that subvert normal fetal developmental programs. We will then discuss both protein and cellular therapeutic approaches that have the potential to be highly impactful with the goal of defining safer and more effective standards of care.
SearchResultBody: ED046. Recent Advances and Future Directions in Immunotherapeutic Approaches to Childhood Solid Malignancies
Title: Recent Advances and Future Directions in Immunotherapeutic Approaches to Childhood Solid Malignancies
